alert.note: Alert for Rutherford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 11:01PM EDT until June 20 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Rutherford. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, greenways, parks, boat-access areas, golf courses, low-water crossings, and low-lying roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1054 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in a very localized area between Bostic and Sunshine. Nuisance to Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen in about 60-90 minutes, but totals up to 5 inches were reported via rain gauge in a very isolated location along Puzzle Creek near Walker Mill Rd and Terry Rd. - Heavy rainfall has ended across the Advisory area. However, additional rainfall is expected overnight. This additional rain may exacerbate ongoing flooding or cause new flooding to develop. A Flash Flood Warning may be required due to wet antecedent conditions. Please stay weather aware and be prepared to seek higher ground should heavy rain develop. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Forest City, Spindale, Bostic, Alexander Mills and Sunshine.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
